alert.note: Alert for Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 15 at 5:13PM EDT until April 15 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT FOR EASTERN ESCAMBIA...SOUTHEASTERN CONECUH...SOUTHWESTERN COVINGTON...NORTHERN OKALOOSA AND NORTHEASTERN SANTA ROSA COUNTIES... At 412 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Castleberry to 11 miles east of Riverview to 10 miles west of Baker, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Andalusia, Laurel Hill and Lockhart. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
